sen.j: 大津市（おおつし）は、滋賀県の南西端に位置する都市で、同県の県庁所在地である。
sen.e: Otsu City is a city located at the southwest end of Shiga Prefecture, which is the prefectural capital.
Otsu City is a city located at the southwest end of Shiga Prefecture, which is the prefectural capital.
Otsu City is a city located at the southwest end of Shiga Prefecture, which is the prefectural capital.

sen.j: 中核市に指定されている。
sen.e: It is designated as a core city.
It is designated as a core city.
It is designated as a core city.

sen.j: 天智天皇が近江宮に遷都して以来の歴史を持つ古都であり、世界文化遺産の比叡山延暦寺や園城寺（三井寺）、日吉大社などの神社仏閣をはじめ史跡が多く点在する。
sen.e: It is an ancient capital known since Emperor Tenchi transferred the capital to Omi no miya (Omi Palace), and it is dotted with lots of historical sites including shrines and temples such as Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei as the World Cultural Heritage, Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) and Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine.

It is an ancient capital known since Emperor Tenchi transferred the capital to Omi no miya (Omi Palace), and it is dotted with lots of historical sites including shrines and temples such as Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei as the World Cultural Heritage, Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) and Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine.

It is an ancient capital known since Emperor Tenchi transferred the capital to Omi no miya (Omi Palace), and it is dotted with lots of historical sites including shrines and temples such as Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei as the World Cultural Heritage, Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) and Hiyoshi-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 琵琶湖の重要港湾かつ東海道53番目の宿場だった大津宿を中心に、膳所藩の城下町だった膳所、比叡山の門前町坂本 (大津市)、湖上交易の拠点だった堅田などからなる。
sen.e: Centered around Otsu-juku, which is an important port of Lake Biwa and used to be the 53rd posting station of Tokai-do Road, it consists of Zeze, the castle town of the Zeze Domain, Sakamoto, a temple town of Mt. Hiei, and Katata, a hub of lake-borne trade.
sen.cmt: 用語集には「拠点」がfootholdとありますが、ここで交易の拠点という場合はhubの方が良いと判断しました。また「湖上貿易」は、lake-borne tradeとしました。
sen.e: Centered around Otsu-juku, which is an important port of Lake Biwa and used to be the 53rd posting station of Tokai-do Road, it consists of Zeze, the castle town of the Zeze Domain, Sakamoto, a temple town of Mt. Hiei, and Katata, a hub of lake-borne trade.

Centered around Otsu-juku, which is an important port of Lake Biwa and used to be the 53rd posting station of Tokai-do Road, it consists of Zeze, the castle town of the Zeze Domain, Sakamoto, a temple town of Mt. Hiei, and Katata, a hub of lake-borne trade.

sen.j: 滋賀県の県庁所在地ではあるが、県の南西端に位置し、また京都市に隣接し京都の衛星都市として発展してきたことから、滋賀県の中核都市としての性格は弱い。
sen.e: Although it is the prefectural capital, the feature as a core city of Shiga Prefecture is weak since it is located at the southwest end of the prefecture and adjacent to Kyoto City, and it has been developed as a satellite city of Kyoto.

Although it is the prefectural capital, the feature as a core city of Shiga Prefecture is weak since it is located at the southwest end of the prefecture and adjacent to Kyoto City, and it has been developed as a satellite city of Kyoto.

Although it is the prefectural capital, the feature as a core city of Shiga Prefecture is weak since it is located at the southwest end of the prefecture and adjacent to Kyoto City, and it has been developed as a satellite city of Kyoto.

sen.j: 位置
sen.e: Location
Location
Location

sen.j: 大津市の市域は、琵琶湖の南西岸から南岸にかけて南北に細長く広がっている。
sen.e: The city area of Otsu City stretches from the southwest coast to the south coast of Lake Biwa, long and thinly from north to south.
The city area of Otsu City stretches from the southwest coast to the south coast of Lake Biwa, long and thinly from north to south.
The city area of Otsu City stretches from the southwest coast to the south coast of Lake Biwa, long and thinly from north to south.

sen.j: その名の通り、琵琶湖の水上交通の要衝であった。
sen.e: As its name suggests, it has been an important point of water transport of Lake Biwa.
As its name suggests, it has been an important point of water transport of Lake Biwa.
As its name suggests, it has been an important point of water transport of Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 西隣の京都市との境には比叡山が南北に走り、山を挟んで向かい合う同市との関係が深い。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei runs north-south in the border with Kyoto City to the west, and the relationship with Kyoto City, which lies across the mountain, is deep.
sen.cmt: 「同市との関係も深いが、。」は、サイトでは「同市との関係が深い。」ですので、そのように原文訂正の上、訳出。
sen.e: Mt. Hiei runs north-south in the border with Kyoto City to the west, and the relationship with Kyoto City, which lies across the mountain, is deep.
Mt. Hiei runs north-south in the border with Kyoto City to the west, and the relationship with Kyoto City, which lies across the mountain, is deep.

sen.j: なお、県庁所在地同士が隣接している例は日本では両市のほか、山形市と仙台市、福岡市と佐賀市の計3例がある。
sen.e: There are three cases that capital cities lie adjacent in Japan; the above-mentioned cities, Yamagata City and Sendai City, and Fukuoka City and Saga City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: There are three cases that capital cities lie adjacent in Japan; the above-mentioned cities, Yamagata City and Sendai City, and Fukuoka City and Saga City.
There are three cases that capital cities lie adjacent in Japan; the above-mentioned cities, Yamagata City and Sendai City, and Fukuoka City and Saga City.

sen.j: が、この中でも格段に近接しており、両市の中心部からの距離が約10kmしか離れていない（山形市と仙台市の中心部の距離は約62km、福岡市と佐賀市は約53km）。
sen.e: However, the said cities are especially close to each other in all cities, and the centers of the both cities are only about 10km away (The distance of the centers of Yamagata City and Sendai City is about 62km, that of Fukuoka City and Saga City is about 53km.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: However, the said cities are especially close to each other in all cities, and the centers of the both cities are only about 10km away (The distance of the centers of Yamagata City and Sendai City is about 62km, that of Fukuoka City and Saga City is about 53km).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動
sen.e: However, the said cities are especially close to each other in all cities, and the centers of the both cities are only about 10km away (The distance of the centers of Yamagata City and Sendai City is about 62km, that of Fukuoka City and Saga City is about 53km).

sen.j: 地形
sen.e: Topography
Topography
Topography

sen.j: 湖：琵琶湖
sen.e: Lake: Lake Biwa
Lake: Lake Biwa
Lake: Lake Biwa

sen.j: 川：淀川・大戸川
sen.e: Rivers: Yodo-gawa River, Daido-gawa River
Rivers: Yodo-gawa River, Daido-gawa River
Rivers: Yodo-gawa River, Daido-gawa River

sen.j: 山：比叡山・長等山（ながらやま）・音羽山・田上山（たなかみやま）
sen.e: Mountains: Mt. Hiei, Mt. Nagara, Mr. Otowa, Mt. Tanakami
Mountains: Mt. Hiei, Mt. Nagara, Mr. Otowa, Mt. Tanakami
Mountains: Mt. Hiei, Mt. Nagara, Mr. Otowa, Mt. Tanakami

sen.j: 気候
sen.e: Climate
Climate
Climate

sen.j: 内陸性気候、それに併せて市南部は瀬戸内海式気候、市北部は日本海側気候を示す。
sen.e: It has Inland climate as well as Seto Inland Sea climate in the south and Japan Sea area climate in the north.
It has Inland climate as well as Seto Inland Sea climate in the south and Japan Sea area climate in the north.
It has Inland climate as well as Seto Inland Sea climate in the south and Japan Sea area climate in the north.

sen.j: 豪雪地帯の旧堅田町は冬季雪が多い。
sen.e: The old Katata Town area in the snowy area has a lot of snow in the winter.
The old Katata Town area in the snowy area has a lot of snow in the winter.
The old Katata Town area in the snowy area has a lot of snow in the winter.

sen.j: 縄文時代以前 瀬田川西岸に石山貝塚が築かれる。
sen.e: Before the Jomon period, Ishiyama Shell-Mound was made on the west bank of the Seta-gawa River.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正
sen.e: Before the Jomon period, Ishiyama Shell-Mound was made on the west bank of the Seta-gawa River.

sen.j: 667年（天智天皇6年） 天智天皇が近江大津宮に都を定める。
sen.e: In 667, Emperor Tenchi built the capital at the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu.
667: Emperor Tenchi built the capital at the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 667: Emperor Tenchi built the capital at the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu.

sen.j: 672年（弘文天皇元年） 壬申の乱。
sen.e: In 672, Jinshin War occurred.
672: Jinsh War occurred.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 672: Jinsh War occurred.

sen.j: 瀬田川の橋（後の瀬田の唐橋）をめぐって戦闘が発生、弘文天皇（明治3年（1870年）に弘文天皇の諡号を贈られる。）は自決し近江大津宮は廃絶。
sen.e: A battle erupted over the bridge of the Seta-gawa River (later Seta no Karahashi Bridge), and Prince Otomo (he was given a posthumous name as Emperor Kobun in 1870) committed a suicide, which made the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu extinct.
sen.cmt: 最初の「弘文天皇」はリンク先の単語でサイトでは「大友皇子」となっているので、その通り訳出。後列と結合しました。
sen.e: A battle erupted over the bridge of the Seta-gawa River (later Seta no Karahashi Bridge), and Prince Otomo (he was given a posthumous name as Emperor Kobun in 1870) committed a suicide, which made the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu extinct.

A battle erupted over the bridge of the Seta-gawa River (later Seta no Karahashi Bridge), and Prince Otomo (he was given a posthumous name as Emperor Kobun in 1870) committed a suicide, which made the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu extinct.

sen.j: 奈良時代には瀬田に国府が置かれ、田上山など湖南の山々は平城京造営の木材を搬出する場となる。
sen.e: In the Nara Period, Kokufu (provincial office) was established in Seta, and the timber for constructing the Heijo Palace was come down from the mountains to the south of the lake such as Mt. Tanakami.

In the Nara period, Kokufu (provincial office) was established in Seta, and the timber for constructing the Heijo-kyo Palace came down from the mountains to the south of the lake such as Mt. Tanakami.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正、was come down→came down、Heijo-kyo Palaceとしました。
sen.e: In the Nara period, Kokufu (provincial office) was established in Seta, and the timber for constructing the Heijo-kyo Palace came down from the mountains to the south of the lake such as Mt. Tanakami.

sen.j: 747年（天平19年） 聖武天皇の発願により瀬田川沿いの石山に堂宇を建立、後に石山寺となる。
sen.e: In 747, a temple building was built in Ishiyama along the Seta-gawa River at the wish of Emperor Shomu, which late became Ishiyama-dera Temple.
747: A temple building was built in Ishiyama along the Seta-gawa River at the wish of Emperor Shomu, which late became Ishiyama-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 747: A temple building was built in Ishiyama along the Seta-gawa River at the wish of Emperor Shomu, which late became Ishiyama-dera Temple.

sen.j: 788年（延暦7年） 最澄が比叡山に堂宇を開き、後に延暦寺となる。
sen.e: In 788, Saicho made a temple building in Mt. Hiei, which later became Enryaku-ji Temple.
788: Saicho made a temple building in Mt. Hiei, which later became Enryaku-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 788: Saicho made a temple building in Mt. Hiei, which later became Enryaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 山麓の坂本 (大津市)がその門前町として繁栄。
sen.e: Sakamoto, at the foot of the mountain flourished as its temple town.
Sakamoto, at the foot of the mountain flourished as its temple town.
Sakamoto, at the foot of the mountain flourished as its temple town.

sen.j: 794年（延暦13年） 近江大津宮廃絶後、その跡地は「古津」と呼ばれていたが、平安京遷都を機に大津に復する詔が出される。
sen.e: In 794, after the extinction of the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu, its site was called 'Furutsu,' but an imperial decree was issued to call it Otsu again on the occasion of the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.

794: After the extinction of the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu, its site was called 'Furutsu,' but an imperial decree was issued to call it Otsu again on the occasion of the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 794: After the extinction of the Imperial Palace Omi Otsu, its site was called 'Furutsu,' but an imperial decree was issued to call it Otsu again on the occasion of the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 平安時代の大津は、平安京から東国・北国へと向かう人や物を扱う港となる。
sen.e: In the Heian Period, Otsu became a port to handle people and products heading for Togoku (eastern Japan) and Hokkoku (northern Japan) from Heian-kyo.
In the Heian period, Otsu became a port to handle people and products heading for Togoku (eastern Japan) and Hokkoku (northern Japan) from Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正
sen.e: In the Heian period, Otsu became a port to handle people and products heading for Togoku (eastern Japan) and Hokkoku (northern Japan) from Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 延暦寺と園城寺（三井寺）の抗争が激化し僧兵が登場する。
sen.e: The strife between Enryaku-ji Temple and Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) intensified, and armed priests emerged.
The strife between Enryaku-ji Temple and Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) intensified, and armed priests emerged.
The strife between Enryaku-ji Temple and Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) intensified, and armed priests emerged.

sen.j: 石山寺は多くの平安文学の舞台となる。
sen.e: Ishiyama-dera Temple served as a setting of lots of the Heian literature.
Ishiyama-dera Temple served as a setting of lots of the Heian literature.
Ishiyama-dera Temple served as a setting of lots of the Heian literature.

sen.j: 1096年（嘉保3年） 永長東海地震。
sen.e: In 1096, the Eicho-Tokai earthquake occurred.
1096: The Eicho-Tokai earthquake occurred.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1096: The Eicho-Tokai earthquake occurred.

sen.j: 瀬田の橋が落ちるなど大きな被害。
sen.e: There were heavy damages such as the collapsed bridge of Seta.
There were heavy damages such as the collapsed bridge of Seta.
There were heavy damages such as the collapsed bridge of Seta.

sen.j: 1184年（寿永3年） 木曾義仲、今井兼平主従、源義経、源範頼らとの粟津の戦いに敗れる。
sen.e: In 1184, it lost against Yoshinaka KISO, Kanehira IMAI and his servants, Yoshitsune MINAMOTO, and Noriyori MINAMOTO at the Battle of Awazu.
1184: It lost against Yoshinaka KISO, Kanehira IMAI and his servants, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and MINAMOTO no Noriyori at the Battle of Awazu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune、MINAMOTO no Noriyoriとしました。
sen.e: 1184: It lost against Yoshinaka KISO, Kanehira IMAI and his servants, MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and MINAMOTO no Noriyori at the Battle of Awazu.

sen.j: 室町時代に入ると延暦寺の勢力はますます大きくなり、足利義教や細川政元ら権力者による焼き討ちが相次ぐ。
sen.e: In the Muromachi Period, the power of Enryaku-ji Temple increasingly became big, and it was successively set on fire by powerful people such as Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and Masamoto HOSOKAWA.
In the Muromachi period, the power of Enryaku-ji Temple increasingly became big, and it was successively set on fire by powerful people such as Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and Masamoto HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, the power of Enryaku-ji Temple increasingly became big, and it was successively set on fire by powerful people such as Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and Masamoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 大津や坂本、堅田などが物資の水上運送で繁栄、堅田水軍が活躍。
sen.e: Otsu, Sakamoto and Katata flourished in water transport of goods, and the Katata Navy was active.
Otsu, Sakamoto and Katata flourished in water transport of goods, and the Katata Navy was active.
Otsu, Sakamoto and Katata flourished in water transport of goods, and the Katata Navy was active.

sen.j: 1571年（元亀2年） 織田信長、比叡山焼き討ち (1571年)。
sen.e: In 1571, Nobunaga ODA attacked and burned Mt. Hiei.
1571: Nobunaga ODA attacked and burned Mt. Hiei.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1571: Nobunaga ODA attacked and burned Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: 明智光秀に坂本城を造らせ、琵琶湖の守りとする。
sen.e: He had Mitsuhide AKECHI build Sakamoto-jo Castle, which guarded Lake Biwa.
He had Mitsuhide AKECHI build Sakamoto-jo Castle, which guarded Lake Biwa.
He had Mitsuhide AKECHI build Sakamoto-jo Castle, which guarded Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 1586年（天正14年） 豊臣秀吉、坂本城を廃城にして現在の浜大津の場所に大津城を造らせる。
sen.e: In 1586, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI disposed of Sakamoto-jo Castle, and had Otsu-jo Castle built in the present Hamaotsu.
1586: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI disposed of Sakamoto-jo Castle, and had Otsu-jo Castle built in the present Hamaotsu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1586: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI disposed of Sakamoto-jo Castle, and had Otsu-jo Castle built in the present Hamaotsu.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長5年） 関ヶ原の戦いと同じ頃、大津城の戦いが起こり大津城下は全焼する。
sen.e: In 1600, around the same time as the Battle of Sekigahara, the Battle of Otsu-jo Castle occurred, which made the castle town of Otsu-jo Castle burned down.
1600: Around the same time as the Battle of Sekigahara, the Battle of Otsu-jo Castle occurred, which made the castle town of Otsu-jo Castle burned down.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1600: Around the same time as the Battle of Sekigahara, the Battle of Otsu-jo Castle occurred, which made the castle town of Otsu-jo Castle burned down.

sen.j: 1601年（慶長6年） 徳川家康、大津城を廃城にして大津と瀬田の間に膳所城を造らせる。
sen.e: In 1601, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA disposed of Otsu-jo Castle and had Zeze-jo Castle built between Otsu and Seta.
1601: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA disposed of Otsu-jo Castle and had Zeze-jo Castle built between Otsu and Seta.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1601: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA disposed of Otsu-jo Castle and had Zeze-jo Castle built between Otsu and Seta.

sen.j: 江戸時代に大津は再興。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, Otsu was restored.
In the Edo period, Otsu was restored.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正
sen.e: In the Edo period, Otsu was restored.

sen.j: 琵琶湖を往来する船業者の組合・大津百艘船の本拠が置かれ琵琶湖水運の拠点となる。
sen.e: The base of Otsu hyakusosen, the union of ship operators traversing Lake Biwa, was established there, and it became the hub of water transport of Lake Biwa.
The base of Otsu hyakusosen, the union of ship operators traversing Lake Biwa, was established there, and it became the hub of water transport of Lake Biwa.
The base of Otsu hyakusosen, the union of ship operators traversing Lake Biwa, was established there, and it became the hub of water transport of Lake Biwa.

sen.j: また東海道の宿場である大津宿（天領）は、物資運送と人々の往来で繁栄。
sen.e: And Otsu-juku (a shogunal demesne), a posting station of Tokai-do Road, flourished in transport of goods and traffic of people.
And Otsu-juku (a shogunal demesne), a posting station of Tokai-do Road, flourished in transport of goods and traffic of people.
And Otsu-juku (a shogunal demesne), a posting station of Tokai-do Road, flourished in transport of goods and traffic of people.

sen.j: 大津絵、大津算盤などが名物となる。
sen.e: Otsu paintings and Otsu abacus became its local specialities.
Otsu paintings and Otsu abacus became its local specialities.
Otsu paintings and Otsu abacus became its local specialities.

sen.j: 膳所城下は膳所藩のもと、しじみ採りや膳所焼が有名になるが藩財政は常に逼迫していた。
sen.e: The castle town of Zeze-jo Castle under the Zeze Domain became famous for Shijimi clam gathering and Zeze-yaki pottery, but the finance of the domain was always tight.
The castle town of Zeze-jo Castle under the Zeze Domain became famous for Shijimi clam gathering and Zeze-yaki pottery, but the finance of the domain was always tight.
The castle town of Zeze-jo Castle under the Zeze Domain became famous for Shijimi clam gathering and Zeze-yaki pottery, but the finance of the domain was always tight.

sen.j: 1662年（寛文元年） 琵琶湖西岸地震。
sen.e: In 1662, the earthquake at the west coast of Lake Biwa occurred.
1662: The earthquake at the west coast of Lake Biwa occurred.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1662: The earthquake at the west coast of Lake Biwa occurred.

sen.j: 琵琶湖沿岸から京都にかけて倒壊建物・死者多数。
sen.e: Many buildings collapsed and many people died from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.
Many buildings collapsed and many people died from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.
Many buildings collapsed and many people died from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.

sen.j: 膳所城で建物の倒壊。
sen.e: The buildings of the Zeze-jo Castle collapsed.
The buildings of the Zeze-jo Castle collapsed.
The buildings of the Zeze-jo Castle collapsed.

sen.j: 1698年（元禄11年） 堅田藩が立藩、1826年まで続く。
sen.e: In 1698, the Katata Domain was founded, which lasted until 1826.
1698: The Katata Domain was founded, which lasted until 1826.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1698: The Katata Domain was founded, which lasted until 1826.

sen.j: 1868年（明治元年） 大津県が置かれる。
sen.e: In 1868, Otsu Prefecture was established.
1868: Otsu Prefecture was established.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1868: Otsu Prefecture was established.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年） 大津〜海津間に汽船航路が開通。
sen.e: In 1869, a steamer line was opened between Otsu and Kaizu.
1869: A steamer line was opened between Otsu and Kaizu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1869: A steamer line was opened between Otsu and Kaizu.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年） 膳所城取り壊し、翌年膳所藩は膳所県になる。
sen.e: In 1870, Zeze-jo Castle was demolished, and the Zeze Domain became Zeze Prefecture in the following year.
1870: Zeze-jo Castle was demolished, and the Zeze Domain became Zeze Prefecture in the following year.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1870: Zeze-jo Castle was demolished, and the Zeze Domain became Zeze Prefecture in the following year.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年） 滋賀県成立、大津は県庁所在地に。
sen.e: In 1872, Shiga Prefecture was established, and Otsu became its prefectural capital.
1872: Shiga Prefecture was established, and Otsu became its prefectural capital.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1872: Shiga Prefecture was established, and Otsu became its prefectural capital.

sen.j: 1880年（明治13年） 逢坂山トンネル開通、京都と鉄道が繋がる。
sen.e: In 1880, Osakayama Tunnel was opened, which made the railroad connected with Kyoto.
1880: Osakayama Tunnel was opened, which made the railroad connected with Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1880: Osakayama Tunnel was opened, which made the railroad connected with Kyoto.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年） 大津〜長浜間の連絡汽船に代わる鉄道が完成、東海道本線開通。
sen.e: In 1889, a railroad replacing the ferry boat between Otsu and Nagahama was opened, which made the Tokaido Main Line opened.
1889: A railroad replacing the ferry boat between Otsu and Nagahama was opened, which made the Tokaido Main Line opened.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1889: A railroad replacing the ferry boat between Otsu and Nagahama was opened, which made the Tokaido Main Line opened.

sen.j: 1890年（明治23年） 琵琶湖疏水完成。
sen.e: In 1890, Lake Biwa Canal was completed.
1890: Lake Biwa Canal was completed.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1890: Lake Biwa Canal was completed.

sen.j: 琵琶湖沿岸から京都への水運が通じる。
sen.e: The water transport was connected from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.
The water transport was connected from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.
The water transport was connected from the coast of Lake Biwa to Kyoto.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）5月11日 大津事件。
sen.e: On May 11, 1891, the Otsu Incident occurred.
May 11, 1891: The Otsu Incident occurred.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: May 11, 1891: The Otsu Incident occurred.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）10月1日 市制施行により大津市となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1898, Otsu City was established by enforcement of municipal organization.
October 1, 1898: Otsu City was established by enforcement of municipal organization.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: October 1, 1898: Otsu City was established by enforcement of municipal organization.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年） 南郷洗堰（現在の瀬田川洗堰）完成。
sen.e: In 1905, Nango Weir (present Setagawa Weir) was completed.
1905: Nango Weir (present Setagawa Weir) was completed.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: 1905: Nango Weir (present Setagawa Weir) was completed.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）5月10日 滋賀村を編入合併。
sen.e: On May 10, 1932, Shiga Village was incorporated.
May 10, 1932: Shiga Village was incorporated.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正
sen.e: May 10, 1932: Shiga Village was incorporated.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年）4月1日 大津市（旧制）、膳所町、石山町の1市2町が新設合併し、新制の大津市となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1933, one city and two towns - (the old) Otsu City, Zeze town and Ishiyama Town - were newly incorporated, which became the new Otsu City.
April 1, 1933: One city and two towns - (the old) Otsu City, Zeze Town and Ishiyama Town - were newly incorporated, which became the new Otsu City.
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正、townの頭文字を大文字に変更
sen.e: April 1, 1933: One city and two towns - (the old) Otsu City, Zeze Town and Ishiyama Town - were newly incorporated, which became the new Otsu City.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）4月1日 雄琴村、坂本村、下阪本村、大石村、下田上村を編入合併。
sen.e: On April 1, 1951, Ogoto Village, Sakamoto Village, Shimosakamoto Village, Oishi Village and Shimotanakami Village were incorporated.
April 1, 1951: Ogoto Village, Sakamoto Village, Shimosakamoto Village, Oishi Village and Shimotanakami Village were incorporated.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）4月1日 瀬田町、堅田町を編入合併。
sen.e: On April 1, 1967, Seta Town and Katata Town were incorporated.
April 1, 1967: Seta Town and Katata Town were incorporated.

sen.e: April 1, 1967: Seta Town and Katata Town were incorporated.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年） 「世界の文化遺産及び自然遺産の保護に関する条約」（世界遺産条約）に基づいて、延暦寺が金閣寺、清水寺などと共に世界遺産に登録される。
sen.e: In 1994, Enryaku-ji Temple was registered as a World Heritage site along with Kinkaku-ji Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple under the 'Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage' (World Heritage Convention).

1994: Enryaku-ji Temple was registered as a World Heritage site along with Kinkaku-ji Temple and Kiyomizu-dera Temple under the 'Convention Concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage' (World Heritage Convention).

sen.j: - 天智天皇が日本で初めて水時計（漏刻）を設置した故事に因み、時計博物館を併設。
sen.e: It has also the Clock Museum, in connection with the historical event that Emperor Tenchi installed a water clock (rokoku) for the first time in Japan.
It has also the Clock Museum, in connection with the historical event that Emperor Tenchi installed a water clock (rokoku) for the first time in Japan.
It has also the Clock Museum, in connection with the historical event that Emperor Tenchi installed a water clock (rokoku) for the first time in Japan.

sen.j: - 松尾芭蕉ゆかりの神社。
sen.e: This shrine is related to Basho MATSUO.
This shrine is related to Basho MATSUO.
This shrine is related to Basho MATSUO.

sen.j: - 表門は膳所城から移築されたもので国の重要文化財。
sen.e: Its front gate was moved from Zeze-jo Castle, and is the National Important Cultural Property.
Its front gate was moved from Zeze-jo Castle, and is the National Important Cultural Property.
Its front gate was moved from Zeze-jo Castle, and is the National Important Cultural Property.

sen.j: - 祓戸大神を祀る名神大社
sen.e: It is a Myojin-taisha Shrine enshrining Haraedo-no-okami.
It is a Myojin Taisha (the highest-ranked shrines defined by the ancient Engishiki law) enshrining Haraedo no okami.
sen.cmt: Myojin-taisha Shrine→Myojin Taishaとし、補足追加、Haraedo-no-okamiのハイフン消去

sen.j: - 本殿は国の重要文化財。

sen.j: - 音曲諸芸道の神。
